div.p:
April 6, 2020
PCS Families: If you haven’t yet signed up for the Remind app, text the following to the number 81010 –

April 3, 2020
Beginning on Tuesday, April 7th, to support the health of school-age children, their families, and our city’s food service workers, all Grab N Go meal sites will be distributing several days’ worth of free meals to Providence children 18 and younger on Tuesdays and Fridays only instead of five days a week. Paul Cuffee students must be present at the distribution site to pick up their meals. Click here for more information.

p.a: Message to Families: Chromebook Pickup Sessions

div.p:
March 18, 2020
The City of Providence will be offering free, packaged dinner meals beginning Wednesday, March 18 at each of Providence’s eleven recreation centers. Meals can be picked up between 4:00pm – 6:00pm weekdays by residents 18 and under but they must be personally present at the distribution site. No ID is required. For more information visit http://www.providenceri.gov/city-announces-grab-go-dinners-available-recreation-centers-providence-youth/

March 15, 2020
All children 18 and younger may receive free meals beginning next week, Tuesday, March 17 from 11am- 2pm at “Grab and Go” lunch sites (listed below) throughout Providence. No ID is required. Visit https://www.providenceschools.org/grabandgo for details.

ul.li: Gilbert Stuart Middle School, 188 Princeton St.
Juanita Sanchez High School, 182 Thurbers Ave.
Mt. Pleasant High School, 434 Mt. Pleasant Ave.
Providence Career and Technical Academy, 41 Fricker St.
Vartan Gregorian Elementary School, 455 Wickenden St.

div.p:
March 13, 2020
In accordance with the Governor’s directive, Paul Cuffee School will be closed for the week of March 16 to ensure the optimal health of our learning community. All school-related events, activities and meetings have been postponed until further notice.
